content: For PSET 1, on part 3 test 03, my default "rate" was .5 which I did not change, however I output 0, and since the grader checks the variable value and not the output, it says I was incorrect. The TA who checked my code said that the way I did it should be correct, and so I was wondering if I could get the points back.
subject: Autograder error

content: @Kuan Wei Huang manual grading? but it seems like they just didn't follow instructions
i.e. we would then have to award points back to everyone who made this mistake, which would be hard to track
I agree. Maybe assure them they will be on the "special considerations list" in case their final grade is borderline.

Since the pset instructions do say that the value of r in that case should be zero, it would be unfair for us to award points back in this case. However, we will keep it in mind when we evaluate final grades.
